name: Great Harbor
culture_adjustments: Dockside guilds supersede some kinship functions
Harbor law and customs more codified than rural oral traditions
Higher density of foreign merchants; more cosmopolitan etiquette
Ritual seamanship rites are more frequent and guild-controlled
Marketplace speech contains more Island Creole loanforms
constraints: Ritual navigational auguries consume scarce imported reagents controlled by guilds
Limited combustion/steam industry capacity; no high-pressure megatech
notes: Monsoonal fisheries drive seasonal labor peaks
Shipyards require steady timber imports and protected slipways
